p: Extraction of the essential oil from the aerial part of the tree was carried out by steaming with a Clevenger-type apparatus [ 20], in a 5-liter balloon containing 2 liters of distilled water. The extractions were repeated three times in order to recover considerable volumes. The essential oil obtained has been stored in small, opaque bottles and placed in a refrigerator at 4Â°C until used for testing antioxidant and antibacterial activities.
